title: Black Eye Treatment
author: WebMD Editorial Contributors

sections.heading: 1. Treat Symptoms
bullets: Apply ice to the area. Don't press on the eye .
For pain, give acetaminophen ( Panadol , Tylenol ). Don't give aspirin or ibuprofen ( Advil , Motrin ), because they can increase bleeding.

sections.heading: 2. Get Medical Help
content: See a healthcare provider to make sure there is no further damage to the eye.
Call a healthcare provider immediately if:
bullets: The person's vision is blurred, double, or lost in either eye .
The person is in severe pain.
You suspect a serious eye injury.
There is drainage or bleeding on the white part of the eye or drainage from the eye.
The eyeball or pupil looks abnormal.
Skin around the eye is split or there is a cut on the eyelid.

sections.heading: 3. Follow Up
bullets: Continue icing the area several times a day for 1 or 2 days.
After 1 or 2 days, apply warm compresses to the bruised area instead.
Depending on the injury, the provider may prescribe eye drops and recommend follow up with an eye doctor.
